results.title: Metformin a Potential Pharmacological Strategy in Late Onset Alzheimer's Disease Treatment
results.text_hl: Consequently, @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@ has been referred to "@<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Noninsulin_Dependent_3</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566342 @@@type 3 diabetes@@@" and antidiabetic medications such as intranasal @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Thiazolidinediones @CHEMICAL_MESH:D045162 @@@glitazones@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or liraglutide are being tested as possible alternatives.

citations.NLM: Poor SR, Ettcheto M, Cano A, Sanchez-Lopez E, Manzine PR, Olloquequi J, Camins A, Javan M. Metformin a Potential Pharmacological Strategy in Late Onset Alzheimer's Disease Treatment Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2021 Sep 1;14(9):. PMID: 34577590
citations.BibTeX: @article{34577590, title={Metformin a Potential Pharmacological Strategy in Late Onset Alzheimer's Disease Treatment}, author={Poor SR and Ettcheto M and Cano A and Sanchez-Lopez E and Manzine PR and Olloquequi J and Camins A and Javan M}, journal={Pharmaceuticals (Basel)}, volume={14}, number={9}}

results.title: Reconsidering repurposing: long-term metformin treatment impairs cognition in Alzheimer's model mice
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a primary anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ medication, has been anticipated to provide benefits for @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@ (@DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@AD@@@), also known as "@<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Noninsulin_Dependent_3</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566342 @@@type 3 diabetes@@@".

citations.NLM: Cho SY, Kim EW, Park SJ, Phillips BU, Jeong J, Kim H, Heath CJ, Kim D, Jang Y, López-Cruz L, Saksida LM, Bussey TJ, Lee DY, Kim E. Reconsidering repurposing: long-term metformin treatment impairs cognition in Alzheimer's model mice Transl Psychiatry. 2024 Jan 18;14(1):34. PMID: 38238285
citations.BibTeX: @article{38238285, title={Reconsidering repurposing: long-term metformin treatment impairs cognition in Alzheimer's model mice}, author={Cho SY and Kim EW and Park SJ and Phillips BU and Jeong J and Kim H and Heath CJ and Kim D and Jang Y and López-Cruz L and Saksida LM and Bussey TJ and Lee DY and Kim E}, journal={Transl Psychiatry}, volume={14}, number={1}, pages={34}}

results.title: Comparator clinical trials of surrogate endpoints with albiglutide are in HARMONY.
results.text_hl: HARMONY 3: 104-Week randomized, double-blind, placebo- and active-controlled trial assessing the efficacy and safety of albiglutide compared with placebo, @CHEMICAL_Sitagliptin_Phosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068900 @@@sitagliptin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_glimepiride @CHEMICAL_MESH:C057619 @@@glimepiride@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Noninsulin_Dependent_3</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566342 @@@type 3 diabetes@@@ taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Doggrell SA. Comparator clinical trials of surrogate endpoints with albiglutide are in HARMONY. Expert Rev Endocrinol Metab. 2015 May;10(3):273-276. PMID: 30298769
citations.BibTeX: @article{30298769, title={Comparator clinical trials of surrogate endpoints with albiglutide are in HARMONY.}, author={Doggrell SA}, journal={Expert Rev Endocrinol Metab}, volume={10}, number={3}, pages={273-276}}
